data.title: Excellent Tour w/ Phillip Westen!
data.text: We so enjoyed Phillip and his "intuitiveness" with Ghosts.  He was a great story teller and kept our whole family entertained.  We have a 10 and a 17 year old and the historic walk is something we did as a family and one we will never forget.  Thank you Phillip -you were engaging to all of us and we so enjoyed meeting you!

data.title: Must Do
data.text: Arlene was our tour guide.  We met at the St. Francis hotel.  She was very knowledgeable, friendly, funny, interesting and paid attention to our group, always making sure we were all together before starting her next explanation.  Took us to very interesting places and gave us much information.  My daughter lives in Santa Fe but had never taken a tour and learned A LOT.  I highly recommend this historic walking tour.

data.title: Excellent Tour
data.text: This was one of the best tours I have ever taken.  It provides a thorough and interesting history of Santa Fe and the surrounding areas.  It includes entrance to the St Francis Basilica and the Loretto Chapel.  Our guide, whose name I can't recall but who is Polish in origin was fantastic.  She also offered many helpful tips about the city.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Very enriching tour of downtown historic area
data.text: We joined the tour at St. Francis hotel on a Tuesday morning.  Our guide was young woman Iwona (spelling?) originally from Poland.  The two hours passed very quickly.  We paused to sit in a few places while she told us about history of area from early Spanish colonists, through Pueblo Revolt to Los Alamos Manhattan Project to a Jeff Bridges movie filmed here.  Again, both my husband and I  liked our tour and guide. We found the  tour  educational, interesting, and  well worth the $14/person cost (which included entry to Loretto Chapel).

data.title: Other tours might be more informative
data.text:
Although we had already walked Santa Fe's small historic district the day before, we were keen to fill the gaps in our knowledge about the city and its history.  Unfortunately, we were not much the wiser after our 1.75 hour walking tour with Phill.  

The brochure advertises this tour as 'the most interesting and enriching way to see the city'.  Phill's talk was neither factually accurate (mistaking the dates for some key events) nor especially interesting (going off on long tangents about nothing in particular).  

Phill did not seem inclined to walk much on this tour:  We started at 76 E. San Francisco St, where we stood around for several minutes, then walked across the Plaza to stand around some more in front of the Governor's Palace.  Then walked over to the Cathedral, via Sena Plaza, and finally to the Loretto Chapel.  Based on IPad technology, we reckon we walked less than 500 yards.    In almost two hours, it should be possible also to walk to the State Capitol, the San Miguel Mission and the Oldest House, in addition to the sites covered.  

Phill seems to be a nice, pleasant person - but perhaps not best suited to the role of tour guide.  We'd recommend looking at other walking or tram-based tours of this historic city- or even take the self-guided tour, available free from the Tourist Information office and save yourself some cash.

data.title: A wonderful historic walk of Santa Fe
data.text:
We joined the Historic Walk of Santa Fe at the St Francis Hotel at 9:45am on a Tuesday morning.  What a wonderful experience we had.  Our guide Ivona was so knowledgeable, 
interesting and a delightful person.   For a meer $14/ person we were given an informative  2 hour tour of the Plaza area.  I can highly recommend this tour.

data.title: Great way to get too know the area
data.text: They stick to the facts  and provide hearing pods so you don't have to cluster around the tour person. Ours was a very nice man who herded us thought the typical sites and had a wealth of info and stories. Nice that he would distinguish between the myths and historical facts. Just know that you don't go into the Churches as most of them have tours themselves.

data.title: Great Way to Start Your Visit
data.text: We were in Santa Fe last week and my brother recommended taking this tour as a starting point to exploring the city. We met our tour guide (I think his name was Elliot)  at the Hilton. We made one more hotel stop and then were on our way. Our guide was very informative and started off in a unique way by taking our small group into one of the stores that sells pottery. There he pointed out and explained the different techniques and named several of the prominent artists from New Mexico. It helped explain the name of one of the persons honored with a star outside the art museum. That was another interesting stop. We also went into an open courtyard where information was given relating to the place's significance to Los Alamos. Plenty of history was given along the way and we were frequently encouraged to ask questions. The last stop was at the Loretto Chapel where the cost of the tour was included in our tour price. This definitely was the way to start our visit in Santa Fe. Our guide also gave us several restaurants to try both in the plaza area and a few further out. That was much appreciated and we tried two places he recommended. Both were great!

data.title: A Nice Introduction to Santa Fe
data.text: A great way to get a little taste of what Santa Fe has to offer.  I have no doubt you could take this tour with different guides and get different stories and highlights.  Highly recommend this as a first stop on a trip to Santa Fe, as it will give you ideas of things you might want to explore further.  Early in the tourist season, so there were just a few of us, but got the full tour.

data.title: Always a favorite, always different, this is a special way to get a feeling for Santa fe
data.text: This 1.5 to 2 hour walking tour is the one that leaves from the st. Francis hotel.  I'm a frequent visitor to Santa Fe and never get tired of starting my visit with this tour because it is always different than, depending upon the guide.  Each guide brings a novel perspective to the walk, and as a participant, you see Santa Fe through the guide's personal passion.  The tour includes many of the highlights, even a stop at the Loretta staircase which is included.  Arlene, my guide this time, was one of the top I've had do the tour. Her passion for art and architecture, and the details of the MAnhattan Project brought us into places that I hadn't been in before.....she was a winner, as is this tour.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Historic Downtown Santa Fe, New Mexico
data.text: We were only in Santa Fe, New Mexico for one day, but we made sure to walk around the historic downtown area. It was a wonderful way to spend the afternoon. I especially loved the plaza where one could just sit and enjoy the quaint feel of the place. With the church bells ringing in the distant background and the sound of children laughing in the park, it was very peaceful. We went in the late afternoon during the week so it may be busier on the weekend. Cool place though for sure.

data.title: History Lesson
data.text: Our guide was very knowledgable and was especially kind to the children in the group. The tour lasted about two hours, and admission to the Loretto Chapel was included in the reasonable $14 fee (plus tip). Other sites visited were the Plaza, a hotel, the art museum lobby, the outside of the Palace of the Governors, the courtyard of a shop, and the outside of the Cathedral. I would recommend this tour if you are really interested in history and haven’t read anything about Santa Fe’s past. I myself didn’t enjoy the tour and was glad when it was over. It was too wordy and too focused on history. I would not recommend this tour for kids - they will be bored.

data.title: Walking tour
data.text: Our guide Arlene was very pleasant and knowledgable of the history and culture of Santa Fe . We took the afternoon tour meeting at the St Francis hotel and we got a private tour as no one else came. We saw all the major sites and some that others cannot go into without the tour. The walking was well paced with stops. She also gave us great recommendations for dinner and other sights to see in the area. We definitely would recommend this tour group.

data.title: Encompassing and Informative tour of Santa Fe
data.text:
Our walking tour only had one other couple with it so our experience seemed more personal and the tour guide, Elliot, cracked some jokes and didn't have to be "on" the whole time. It was a very informative tour of Santa Fe and we ended up seeing just about every spot in the downtown area we had already planned on visiting. One or two places we were even able to avoid paying the entry fee to go inside. Elliot was able to answer pretty much any question we threw at him and incorporated not only the origins of Santa Fe into the tour but recent history like the Manhattan Project into it. It was really cool to connect what we heard on the tour with what we saw in the museums later.

The only complaint we had was that while walking it was hard to hear Elliot since he was in the front of the group and facing forward while talking. Some things we either missed or had him repeat later.

data.title: Historic indeed, an informative tour of Santa Fe
data.text: My guide was really sweet and very knowledgable. It was snowing and 20 degrees out, so I was the only taker, and ended up getting a private tour. I learned all about the history of Santa Fe's beginnings. The tour guide had great recommendations for sites outside the city and local spots that I wouldn't have known about.

data.title: Great Tour Guide
data.text: Arlene was an excellent tour guide.  Extremely knowledgeable in all areas from architecture, past and current history.

data.title: More walking... less talking please.
data.text:
My husband and I had a very short stop in Santa Fe and were hoping to get a good overview of the main downtown by taking a 90 minute walking tour with this company. It was really affordable and available at the times we needed. We showed up, paid our fee in cash to the tour guide, and settled in to hear all about this town we were so excited to visit. It began indoors in a small strip mall near their offices. The guide did the usual introductions and then launched into a 15-20 min presentation on the history of New Mexico. All of the people on the tour started enthusiastic to go on the walking tour, bundled up in warm clothes (it was about 29 degrees out), but after a short time, everyone started to grab seats on the indoor benches and take off their coats. It was clear we were in for a much longer talk than expected, and as of this point, did zero walking.

After about 30 minutes, we headed outside. Yay! Everyone bundled up again and we walked... across the street. To a plaque. Where the guide had us all stand still in the freezing cold and talked another 20-30 minutes about more history of New Mexico and and the old west. All throughout promising to "show" us the historical points he was referencing later in the tour. Everyone was freezing and visibly bored, shifting, and even taking pictures around them while the guide continued to talk. 

At this point, about an hour had passed and we had literally only waked across the street and stared at a plaque. My anxiety over the fact that this tour only had 30 more minutes to go (and we had only about an hour left in the town before WE needed to begin driving to our next destination), my husband and I decided to try to get the guide's attention (to no avail, since he didn't really pay attention to any of us) and just quietly walked away from the tour group down the block. We forfeited our fee and spent the next hour visiting the main square, a few galleries, the basilica, had some coffee and french tarts at the french bakery and took pictures. 

I'm not sure if there are multiple guides, but the one we had that day seemed to be somewhat out of touch with the group. He clearly knew his stuff and was a pleasant person, but I think his information would have been better received if he "toured" us while talking and pointed out highlights. It is a walking tour, after all.

data.title: Historic Walk of Santa Fe
data.text:
We had a wonderful guide. She was very knowledgeable  and enthusiastic  and gave us very interesting information about the architecture  and history of Santa Fe.
Also it was wonderful to be able to take our dogs on our walking tour. Our guide held  the dogs while we went into the churches.  She was so accommodating.
It's  a wonderful way to get acquainted with the city.  Highly recommended!

data.title: Great introduction to Historic Santa Fe
data.text: We met our guide at 9:30 am in the lobby of the Eldorado hotel. We made several stops at other hotels nearby to pick up any more people wanting to do the walk. Our Guide was very informative and told us some very interesting stories about Santa Fe. We not only saw a lot in the historic district but also learned quite a bit about Santa Fe's history. This is a great way to see a lot of sites and also get some interesting tidbits about their history. Well worth doing!

data.title: Worth the time
data.text: Tour was more than we expected. Very informative about the history of the town as well as the local life. Highly recommended for travelers who have never visited Santa Fe before.
